message.content:
cs.DB, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CR 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DB (Database): The paper deals with matching entities across different location-enhanced services, which involves handling large volumes of data and developing a scalable linking algorithm. This aligns with the scope of the Database sub-category. 
2. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks): The paper discusses the matching of spatio-temporal usage records belonging to the same real-world entity across different location-enhanced services. This involves analyzing social and information networks and their interactions, which falls under the scope of the Social and Information Networks sub-category. 
3. cs.IR (Information Retrieval): The paper involves developing a linkage model and a scalable linking algorithm to match entities from two sets of spatio-temporal usage records belonging to two different location-enhanced services. This involves retrieving relevant information from large datasets, which aligns with the scope of the Information Retrieval sub-category. 
4. cs.CY (Computers and Society): The paper discusses the use of location-enhanced services and the potential privacy implications of linking spatio-temporal usage records belonging to the same real-world entity across different services. This aligns with the scope of the Computers and Society sub-category. 
5. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper briefly mentions the potential privacy implications of linking spatio-temporal usage records across different location-enhanced services. This involves ensuring the security and privacy
